HTMLMeterElementOptimum.summary: The optimum property of the interface represents the optimum boundary of the {{htmlelement("meter")}} element as a floating-point number. It reflects the element's optimum attribute, or the midpoint between min and max values if not defined. The value of optimum is clamped by the min and max values.

remarks.para: This property can also be set directly, for example to set a default value based on some condition.

HTMLMeterElementOptimum.value: A number. Defaults to the midpoint between and if not defined.
